content: https://cryptohomepages.comProblem:Crypto has come a long way in the last few years and keeping up with all the available tools can be difficult even for the most organized individuals. In the past, I've been able to use my browser bookmarks bar for easy navigation between different crypto platforms, but with each new blockchain, my bookmark bar has become more and more congested.Because I've been mostly been living off profits from crypto since 2017, it has kind of put me in a comfort zone where learning new skills and being productive has not been necessary to thrive financially, I've lost great deal of time not learning any new real skills. Fortunately 2023 Brought along artificial intelligence and ChatGPT that enabled asking questions and getting expert answers about any technical venture for a complete dummie like myself. Therefore I decided to learn website creation and create useful link directory available for everyone. During the process of creating this website, I have explored, learned about and evaluated thousands of websites and selected only the best in each category. I have currently written 25 product reviews in 5 articles and learned about the mechanics of SEO and will continue to do so as this website will never be fully completed as long as crypto ecosystem keeps evolving.Solution:https://cryptohomepages.comCurrent Features:Ultimate link directory to save space in your browser bookmark barEasily find trusted utility platforms for most popular blockchainsConveniently filter out the utility you are looking for using the tag filtersClick on the INFO button of each link to see further information and its corresponding links to social media and servicesDiscover awesome research platforms to improve your DYOR gameExplore best available artificial intelligence platformsAt the time of writing, there are 25 product reviews to readIf your platform is already listed or you have awesome platform that is not yet listed, I'd gladly list it and write dedicated product review article in exchange for shoutout on your platform social mediaFuture Plans:1. Completing and continuing to keep up-to-date the artificial intelligence link page2. Creating page for useful free browser tools and extensions that will improve creative work and save money and time for content creators and internet users.3. Adding couple of new categories for top tier unbiased content creators and miscellaneous platforms that currently doesn't fit in anywhere.4. Creating dedicated page for each top blockchain such as:EthereumBinance Smart ChainPolygonSolanaCardanoAlgorandAvalancheFantomArbitrumOptimismPolkadotKusamaAnd other new upper-coming blockchains that will be gaining adoption and activity.Marketing and monetization:1. I'm planning to start contacting all the listed platforms to offer them dedicated product reviews in exchange for shoutout on twitter.2. There are currently about 10 affiliate links in the whole mix.3. Maybe will offer advertisement options in the future.If you found this website useful, then please consider following its progress on twitter: https://twitter.com/C_Homepages_com

Thanks a lot for your reply. I'm glad that you like the idea and the design. The design still needs some adjustments for example, i've been using 3840x2160px 65" screen during the development, but yesterday when i switched to my 14" laptop, i noticed that links that have longer than avarage names, have been squeezed on top of each other in a bad way. Hopefully im going to be able to find a custom css fix for it today.(Edit: Fixed the smaller screen text overlap issue quite effortlessly. thanks to chatGPT once again!)As for arranging site "ranks", this has been quite difficult thing to figure out. There are many amazing websites in each category and its sad that some of them don't fit on the first page. One of my goal is to bring awareness of some lesser known websites that have great deal of utility to offer. In that particular case, Coingecko made it on the first page only because of its legacy status. While coingecko is very lightweight, without ads and very clean, many of its competitors have been getting ahead. CryptoRank is on its own level. It offers so much unique information that cant be found on any other same category competitors. Messari is another upper comer, however a lot of its utility if for monthly paid subscribers and for that reason, maybe it does not deserve third spot. Still, i believe it is more complete crypto knowledge center than coingecko in today's standards.As for tags, its been such a challenge to figure this one out. I mean, its matter of how far detailed am i going to go. If i put bitcoin tag for every single site that has something about bitcoin there, then its going to be like 90% of them and it renders the whole filter kind of useless. Another thing about using tags is that, for some reason, sometimes it does make all the correct websites pop. Then another times, some websites without the tag still pops. But mostly 98% of times it gets it right. I dont have a clue why they behave like this, but anyway, this is my first ever website. In the future, im going to probably re-do everything and make everything more beautiful and better while trying to correct the current mistakes.For now, i have still a lot of work to do and improve the content.
